cards.rules_text: At the beginning of your upkeep, if an opponent controls more creatures than you, you may reveal the top seven cards of your library. Target opponent chooses a creature card revealed this way. Put that card onto the battlefield, and the rest into your graveyard.

cards.flavor_text:
[i]The moral of the Tale of the Urchin King: heroes get remembered, but villains never die.
[/i]

cards.rules_text: {5}, {T}, Sacrifice Voidlife Orbs: Destroy all nonland permanents. You can't spend more than one color of mana to activate this ability.
cards.flavor_text:
[i]“Relics of a dead civilization. Eternal reminders of why it died.”
—Azamir, “The Empire's Sunset”
[/i]

cards.rules_text: Create X 1/1 white Spirit creature tokens with flying, where X is two plus the number of cards named Wandering Souls in your graveyard. Conjure three cards named Wandering Souls and shuffle them into your main library.
cards.flavor_text:
[i]“The Reaper went walking, ignoring her duties, letting people see what life was like without her.”
—Azamir, “A New Reaper”
[/i]

cards.rules_text:
When Warden of the Dead enters, you draw a card and you lose 1 life.
When Warden of the Dead dies, conjure three cards named Warden of the Dead and shuffle them into your main library. For the rest of the game, you may cast spells named Warden of the Dead without paying their mana costs.
cards.flavor_text:
[i]“The screams that once scared him were now just noise.”
—Azamir, “A New Reaper”
[/i]

cards.rules_text: You may put a Dragon creature card from your hand onto the battlefield. That creature gains haste until end of turn. Return it to its owner's hand at the beginning of the next end step.
cards.flavor_text:
[i]“As Sveth's hand trailed blood on his friend's snout, he asked for vengeance.”
—Azamir, “Prince And Dragonheart”
[/i]

cards.rules_text: Whenever a creature you control enters from a graveyard, target opponent loses life equal to its power.
cards.flavor_text:
[i]“The hero's eyes fluttered open and met with the cultist's. He felt his chest fill with fear and a lack of heartbeats.”
—Azamir, “Fallen And Risen”
[/i]

cards.rules_text:
Search your library for a card, put that card into your hand, then shuffle.
Whenever you cast a spell with mana value 5 or greater, you may cast Words of Eternity from your graveyard without paying its mana cost. If you do, exile it instead of putting it into your graveyard as it resolves.
